      protected java.util.List<PairIntArray> extractSkyline()
      use the output from the canny edge filter and the theta image it produced to find the skyline in the image, extract it as an edge(s) and make several pixels adjustment to align with the output of the canny edge filter (which should be a binary image with edges as 0's).

    • Field Detail

      • state

        protected CurvatureScaleSpaceMapperState state

      • img

        protected GreyscaleImage img

      • originalImg

        protected final ImageExt originalImg

      • edges

        protected java.util.List<PairIntArray> edges
        edges extracted from image. if an instance of PairIntArrayWithColor is present, that holds a color field in which a value of '1' means the curve is closed.

      • skylineEdges

        protected final java.util.List<PairIntArray> skylineEdges
        if extractSkline is true, this is populated with the sky line edge(s).

      • doNotNormalizeByHistogram

        protected boolean doNotNormalizeByHistogram

      • useLineDrawingMode

        protected boolean useLineDrawingMode

      • useLowestHighIntensityCutoff

        protected boolean useLowestHighIntensityCutoff

        protected boolean useOutdoorMode

      • imgHistogram

        protected HistogramHolder imgHistogram

      • filterProducts

        protected EdgeFilterProducts filterProducts

      • junctionMap

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> junctionMap
        map with key = center of junction pixel coordinates; value = set of adjacent pixels when there are more than the preceding and next.

      • junctionLocationMap

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,PairInt> junctionLocationMap
        map with key = pixel coordinates of all pixels involved in junctions; value = PairInt holding index of edge that pixel is located in and holding the index within that edge of the pixel. for example, a pixel located in edges(0) at offset=100 would have PairInt(0, 100) as a value.

      • log

        protected java.util.logging.Logger log

        public AbstractCurvatureScaleSpaceMapper(ImageExt input,

        constructor with input image and the already extracted edges. The input image is needed only for debugging purposes and may be removed as an argument after testing is complete.

    • Method Detail

      • doNotPerformHistogramEqualization

        public void doNotPerformHistogramEqualization()
        apply histogram normalization before processing. For some images, this will increase the contrast of fainter features.

      • useLowestHighIntensityCutoff

        public void useLowestHighIntensityCutoff()

      • useLowHighIntensityCutoff

        public void useLowHighIntensityCutoff()

      • useLineDrawingMode

        public void useLineDrawingMode()

      • useOutdoorMode

        public void useOutdoorMode()

      • useOutdoorModeAndExtractSkyline

        public void useOutdoorModeAndExtractSkyline()
        set the edge detector to create edges that are better for outdoor conditions and also extract the skyline from the intermediate image products. Note that the skyline extraction is currently a long running process.

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()

      • reinitializeSpecialization

        protected abstract void reinitializeSpecialization()

      • reinitialize

                            float additionalBlurSigma)

      • applyEdgeFilter

        protected void applyEdgeFilter()

      • extractSkyline

        protected java.util.List<PairIntArray> extractSkyline()
        use the output from the canny edge filter and the theta image it produced to find the skyline in the image, extract it as an edge(s) and make several pixels adjustment to align with the output of the canny edge filter (which should be a binary image with edges as 0's). NOTE that this is currently a long running process.

      • getCannyEdgeFilterSettings

        public CannyEdgeFilterSettings getCannyEdgeFilterSettings()
